text: Mohammad Shahid Islam (known as Kazi Shahid Islam Papul; born 18 May 1963) is a Bangladeshi businessman, politician and the incumbent Jatiya Sangsad member from the Lakshmipur-2 constituency. He was elected as an independent candidate. On 6 June 2020, Islam was detained on allegations of human trafficking and money laundering from Mishref residential area of Kuwait City by Kuwait's CID. Earlier on 27 February, Anti-Corruption Commission of Bangladesh opened an enquiry against Islam who allegedly had amassed Tk 1,400 crore by human trafficking to Kuwait and siphoned off the money to other countries. Islam owns a construction company, Marafie Kuwaitia General Contracting Company, in Kuwait. ==Background and education== Islam was born on 28 May 1963 in Raipur Upazila of Lakshmipur District to Mohammad Nurul Islam and Tuhrun Nesha. ==Political life== Islam defeated Abul Khair Bhuiyan of BNP as an independent politician candidate in the eleventh Jatiya Sangsad elections in 2018. ===Charges in Kuwait=== On 14 July 2020, according to a Kuwait's Public Prosecution report, Papul confessed during interrogation that he had bribed 720,000 dinars (about Tk 20 crore) to two members of Kuwait's National Assembly to facilitate foreign workers' recruitment and financial transactions. ==Personal life== Islam is married to Selina Islam who is also an incumbent Jatiya Sangsad member representing the reserved women's seat-49. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1963 births Category:People from Lakshmipur District Category:Bangladeshi businesspeople Category:11th Jatiya Sangsad members
title: Mohammad Shahid Islam
